Uses of Interface
com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen.IRuntime

  • Packages that use IRuntime 
    Package Description
    com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces  
    com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands  
    com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen  

    • Uses of IRuntime in com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces

      Methods in com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces with parameters of type IRuntime 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void ICandi.ILanguage.execute​(java.lang.String sInvokerUID, IRuntime rt)
      Executes a piece of code (previously prepared).Normally this method is invoked by SCRIPT:execute(...) method.
      void IController.start​(IRuntime rt)
      This method provides the Controller the opportunity access the IRuntime (in case it would be needed).Also provides the Controller the opportunity to perform any initialization tasks.

    • Uses of IRuntime in com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands

      Methods in com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.commands with parameters of type IRuntime 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void ICommand.start​(IRuntime runtime)
      This method is invoked by the Logical Twin after the unit is added into the Twin: it is being to be used by the executable environment and will start receiving and can send messages.

    • Uses of IRuntime in com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen

      Methods in com.peyrona.mingle.lang.interfaces.exen that return IRuntime 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      IRuntime IRuntime.exit​(int millis)
      Gently ends ExEn execution by ending all internal processes.
      IRuntime IRuntime.log​(ILogger.Level level, java.lang.Object message)
      A more generic logging: received Exception is logged if the LogLevel is appropriate.
      When an exception occurs in ExEn, all connected clients has to be informed.
      Where the log will is stored depends on several parameters: 'write_disk' among them.
